trans-unit.source: Sample text - This is an ideal place to enrich your learner's understanding of your topic. Enter as much or as little text here as you want.
You can insert a brief summary of the module here...
Please enter your name and email address and we'll send you your unique course link
Select this link to reveal more info
Reveal the other side of the card
Select this link to reveal the next item
Select this link to reveal the this item

Type your question here.

You can use this space to add additional information or give useful instructions.

Type your question here.

You can use this space to add additional information or give useful instructions.
Do you agree with this statement?

Navigation

Forward/Back arrows: Press on the Forward and Back arrows to move through the course one screen at a time.

Menu button: Pressing the Menu button opens up a list of all of the screens in the course. Pressing on a screen title in the list allows you to jump straight to the specific screen you want.

Learning Content

Interaction buttons: There will often be buttons within the learning content area on each screen (e.g. MORE or SUBMIT). Press on these to move through a series of slides, explore hotspots on an interactive diagram, or answer questions.

Hyperlinks: At some points in the course there may be hyperlinks to external resources. Pressing on these opens a new window in your browser which you must close or minimise to return to the main course.

Are you sure you want to Close the course?

Click Back to return to the course or Close Course to close the course.
We've sent you an email with your unique course link, you can now close this window.
To set the correct answer for a blank - just edit the text within the field
To add multiple correct answers simply separate them by commas.

Welcome to the AZ1001 Protocol Overview Training

Get the knowledge you need to run study AZ1001 at your site.

Navigation

Forward/Back arrows: Click on the Forward and Back arrows to move through the course one screen at a time.

Menu button: Pressing the Menu button opens up a list of all of the screens in the course. Clicking on a screen title in the list allows you to jump straight to the specific screen you want.

Learning Content

Interaction buttons: There will often be buttons within the learning content area on each screen (e.g. MORE or SUBMIT). Press on these to move through a series of slides, explore hotspots on an interactive diagram, or answer questions.

Hyperlinks: At some points in the course there may be hyperlinks to external resources. Pressing on these opens a new window in your browser which you must close or minimise to return to the main course.

Navigation

Forward/Back arrows
Press on the Forward and Back arrows to move through the course one screen at a a time.
Menu button
Pressing on the Menu button opens up a list of all of the screens in the course. Pressing on a screen title in the list allows you to jump straight to the specific screen you want.


Learning Content

Video
Select the play icon to view video content. Select the CC button below the video and select the CC option on the popup to view the video subtitles.
Image launcher
Select the image to view popup text or PDFs. PDFs can be downloaded or opened in a new window in your browser. You must close or minimise this window to return to the main course
Select any image below to view topic descriptions and begin training. [more info icon needed]
This topic provides an overview of the disease under study as well as key endpoints and objectives.
This topic describes the overall design of the study and provides key information on study [phases/periods].
This topic outlines outlines the eligibility criteria for the study and tests your understanding of that criteria.
This topic explains the mechanism of action of the [study drug] as well as correct [drug] handling and administration.
This topic outlines safety information for the study, including adverse event (AE) reporting, concomitant medications, and other considerations.
The Assessment topic tests your knowledge of the Protocol Overview. You need to achieve a score of [80%] to pass the assessment and obtain your certificate.
Scroll down to view the Study Overview topic.
Select the play icon below to view a video of the disease under study.
Select each image below to view the objectives and endpoints for the [study].
This study will compare treatment with [insert study drug name] versus [insert control drug name/placebo].
[Patients/subjects] in this study will be diagnosed with [insert main diagnosis].
Scroll down to view the Study Overview topic.
Select the play icon below to view a video of the disease under study.
Select each image below to view the objectives and endpoints for the [study].
This study will compare treatment with [insert study drug name] versus [insert control drug name/placebo].
[Patients/subjects] in this study will be diagnosed with [insert main diagnosis].
Scroll down to view the Study Design topic.
[Study Synopsis & Timeline] Select the play icon below to view a study synopsis and timeline video.
[Discontinuation and Withdrawal] Select the images below to view criteria for discontinuation and withdrawal.
[Study Design] Select the play icon below to view a study design video.

Discontinuation Criteria
[Patients/Subjects] may have to be discontinued from the [study treatment]. This can occur for a number of reasons including:
  • [Insert main reasons]


Discontinuation Schedule
If a [patient/subject] prematurely discontinues the [study treatment], they should:
  • [Outline what happens to patients/subjects e.g., undergo procedures outlined for the End of Treatment visit].

Withdrawal Criteria
[Patients/Subjects] may have to be withdrawn from the study. This can occur for a number of reasons including:

  • [Insert main reasons]

They may also withdraw from the [trial] at any time without penalty or prejudice to further treatment.



Withdrawal Schedule
If a [patient/subject] prematurely withdraws from the study, they should:

  • [Outline what happens to patients/subjects e.g., undergo procedures outlined for the End of Treatment visit and attend a Follow-Up visit in 3 weeks.]

This is a phase III, randomi[s/z]ed, double-blind, placebo-controlled] study. Approximately [insert number] [patients/subjects] will be [enrolled/randomi[s/z]ed] in the study in sites [worldwide].

This study will consist of [outline phases of the study e.g., a Screening phase of approximately 2 weeks, a Treatment phase of 16 weeks, and a Follow-Up phase of 4 weeks]. We will now look at each phase of the study in more detail.

The [patient's/subject's] involvement in the study will begin when they sign and date the informed consent form (ICF).

After obtaining consent, the [investigator] should [contact the IVRS/IWRS/IXRS to] assign each [patient/subject] an [identification number]. This number will be used to identify the [patient/subject] on study-related documents.

A number of screening procedures will be performed to determine the [patient's/subject's] eligibility for the study. [Insert duration of Screening period e.g., Screening procedures must be performed within 2 weeks of randomi[s/z]ation.]

If the [patient/subject] meets all of the eligibility criteria, they will be randomi[s/z]ed in the study on [Day 1] to one of the treatment arms displayed on screen. [Patients/Subjects] will be randomi[s/z]ed in a ratio of [2:2:2:1].

This is a double-blind study; therefore, neither the investigator nor the [patient/subject] will know to which treatment group the [patient/subject] has been assigned. To maintain the blind, treatment assignment will be performed using the [IVRS/IWRS/IXRS].

After randomi[s/z]ation], [study treatment] will begin. The [patient/subject] will be required to [insert basic dosing requirements, e.g., take the [IP] twice daily].

After randomi[s/z]ation, [combination treatment] will begin. The [patient/subject] will be required to [e.g., take protocol-prescribed doses of their assigned combination treatment for a maximum of six cycles].

At [insert Week], the [patient/subject] will be required to attend an [End of Treatment] visit.

[Insert number of days/weeks] after the [last dose of study treatment/EOT visit], the [patient/subject] will be required to attend a Follow-Up visit.
Scroll down to view the [Patient/Subject] Selection topic.
[Eligibility Overview] Select the play icon below to view the [subject/patient] eligibility overview video.
[Inclusion & Exclusion Criteria] Select the images below to download a PDF of the inclusion and exclusion criteria for the study.

[Case Studies]

Now that you are familiar with the subject eligibility criteria, it is time to apply that knowledge to some subject case studies.

Three subjects are interested in participating in the study. You need to review each case in turn to determine if they are eligible to participate. You can refer to PDF X and Y if you need to check any criteria.

A [patient/subject] must meet all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria before they can be [randomi[s/z]ed to [study] treatment].

Randomi[s/z]ation of an ineligible [patient/subject] will result in a protocol deviation and may impact [patient/subject] safety.
Is this subject eligible to participate in the study?
The subject meets all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and is eligible to participate in the study.
The subject meets all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria and is eligible to participate in the study.

Scroll down to view the Drug Life Cycle topic.
[Study Drug/IP/Treatment] Select the play icon below to view the [study drug] mechanism of action video.
[Formulation] Select the play icon below to view the [drug] formulation video.
[Drug Handling & Administration] Select each tab below to view key aspects of handling and administering the [study drug] at the site.
Sample text - This is an ideal place to enrich your learner's understanding of your topic. Enter as much or as little text here as you want.

• [Describe procedures for return and/or destruction of the study drug e.g., All [study medication/IP/study drug] returned by the subject can be destroyed at the study site or returned to the sponsor once drug accountability has been finali[s/z]ed.]

• [Insert dispensing procedures e.g., [IP] kits will be [labelled/labeled] with unique treatment codes.
  • At each dispensing visit, the investigator must contact the [IVRS/IWRS] to obtain the treatment code to identify the bottle of study treatment to be dispensed to the subject.]

On receipt, ensure that the [study treatment] is stored:

  • [insert storage conditions e.g., at room temperature, in a secure, locked location that is monitored daily]
  • [insert storage conditions e.g., refrigerated between 2 and 8°C in a secure location with restricted access]


[Note to ID: There are two options for storage, room temperature or refrigerated - delete as appropriate].

• [Describe administration procedures e.g., The [patient/subject] will be required to take the [IP] twice daily 12 hours apart, once in the morning and once in the evening.]
  • [Tablets should be taken with a light meal and approximately 240 mL of water.]

• [If applicable, describe method for assessing compliance, e.g., At each study visit, the subject should return all used and unused bottles of the [IP].
  • The investigator should assess treatment compliance by counting the number of remaining tablets and comparing to the amount dispensed.]
• The investigator is responsible for maintaining accurate records so that, at the end of the study, delivery records can be reconciled with records of usage and returned stock.
Sample text - This is an ideal place to enrich your learner's understanding of your topic. Enter as much or as little text here as you want.
Sample text - This is an ideal place to enrich your learner's understanding of your topic. Enter as much or as little text here as you want.

[Insert sponsor name] will supply [insert name of study drug] in [insert formulation e.g., bottles containing 60 capsules, with each capsule containing a dose of 25 mg].

A placebo identical in appearance to the active drug will also be provided.
Scroll down to view the Safety and Other Considerations topic.
[AE Reporting] Select the play icon below to view an AE reporting video.
[Safety and Other Considerations] Select each tab below to view key safety considerations and other important information for this study.
Sample text - This is an ideal place to enrich your learner's understanding of your topic. Enter as much or as little text here as you want.
• [Outline the most important information on contraception in the study.]

• The treatment should not be unblinded except in cases of medical emergencies where the appropriate management of the [patient/subject] requires knowledge of the treatment.
  • The investigator can contact the [IVRS/IWRS/IXRS] to break the treatment code. Where possible, the investigator should contact the [medical monitor] before unblinding the treatment assignment.
  • Any breaking of the code should be reported to [insert sponsor name].
• [Outline the most important concomitant medications in the study.]
• [Outline the most important prohibited medications in the study.]
Sample text - This is an ideal place to enrich your learner's understanding of your topic. Enter as much or as little text here as you want.
Sample text - This is an ideal place to enrich your learner's understanding of your topic. Enter as much or as little text here as you want.

All adverse events (AEs) should be reported from [the start of treatment until the Follow-Up visit.]

All serious adverse events (SAEs) should be reported from [the signing of the ICF until the Follow-Up visit.]

Remember that all SAEs should be reported to [insert sponsor name] [within 24 hours] of becoming aware of the event.

This assessment tests your knowledge of the Protocol Overview lesson.

You need to achieve a score of [80%] to pass the assessment and obtain your certificate.

Question 1 of 10.

If a [patient/subject] is willing to participate in the study, which of the following procedures should be performed first?

Select your answer, and click Submit.
Take a blood sample to confirm eligibility.
Perform [study specific assessment] to assess [study specific].
Record the medications that the [patient/subject] has used within the last 30 days.
You must ensure that written informed consent is obtained from all [patients/subjects] before you conduct any study-related procedure.

You must ensure that written informed consent is obtained from all [patients/subjects] before you conduct any study-related procedure. (If you had difficulty answering this question, refer to the [insert topic name] topic.)

Question 2 of 10.

Which of the following [patients/subjects] cannot be considered for study participation? Select your answers, and click Submit.

Note: You can select more than one answer.
[Patients/Subjects] with [exclusion criterion] cannot be considered for study participation.
[Patients/Subjects] with [exclusion criterion] cannot be considered for study participation. (If you had difficulty answering this question, refer to the [insert topic name] topic.)
[Patients/Subjects] with [exclusion criterion] cannot be considered for study participation. (If you had difficulty answering this question, refer to the [insert topic name] topic.)

Question 3 of 10.

What instructions should you give [patients/subjects] about the administration of the [study medication/IP/study drug]?

Select your answer, and click Submit.
Correct answer e.g., Instruct [patients/subjects] to take the [study medication/IP/study drug] with food at the same time each day in the morning.
Instruct [patients/subjects] to take the [study medication/IP/study drug] with food, at the same time each day in the morning.

Instruct [patients/subjects] to take the [study medication/IP/study drug] with food at the same time each day in the morning. (If you had difficulty answering this question, refer to the [insert topic name] topic.)
[Enter feedback]. (If you had difficulty answering this question, refer to the [insert topic name] topic.)
[Enter feedback]. (If you had difficulty answering this question, refer to the [insert topic name] topic.)
